isis.stitle: CALIPER DISC BRAKES - SERVICE PROCEDURES - REASSEMBLE CALIPER (ALL CODES EXCEPT CODE 04145)

step1.para: Take a new piston seal and dip the seal in clean brake fluid. Install seal into piston bore seal groove by holding seal in groove and gently working seal around into groove. Make sure that the seal is not twisted or rolled. Never use an old seal.
Apply a thin film of silicone grease to the inside edge of the caliper bore and to the sealing lip edge of the dust boot.

Install dust boot onto piston installer tool expanding boot lip only. Insert boot with tool into piston bore. Using suitable tool install boot into caliper housing ( Figure 30and Figure 31). Refer to SPECIAL TOOLS .

figure.caption: Figure 31. Dust Boot and Heat Shield Position

step1.para: Apply brake fluid to the outside surface of the piston. Insert piston into piston installer tool and piston bore. Start piston past piston seal, then push piston down until bottomed, and remove tool.

If no piston tool is available, apply clean brake fluid to outside surface of the caliper piston. Install piston dust boot over top of piston. Note position of the dust boot steel ring edge, facing into caliper bore ( Figure 31).

Install piston into caliper bore. Once piston is started past the seal, use your fingers to push piston down until bottomed. If piston is difficult to bottom using your fingers, you may use a suitable brass punch or piece of wood inserted into the piston opening (hole). Gently tap piston into caliper until the piston is bottomed.
Using a suitable tool, install boot into caliper housing.

Install piston heat shield over piston with the radius of the heat shield facing outward. Press heat shield down on piston against dust boot face using the piston installer tool ( Figure 31). If tool is not available, use suitable tool to tap heat shield onto piston.

note.para: Repeat all the above steps 1 through 8 for the remaining piston(s).

step1.para: Install caliper and pads as outlined in PADS AND CALIPER INSTALLATION .
